metadata.title: CVE-2022-20008 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In mmc_blk_read_single of block.c, there is a possible way to read kernelheap memory due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local informationdisclosure if reading from an SD card that triggers errors, with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-216481035References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
